title: Cable Car 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is on the light side, with simple flavors and a juicy, soft texture that shows very little tannin. Aromas and flavors recall cherries and strawberries.

title: Angulo Innocenti 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (La Consulta)
description: Leafy, green aromas suggest eucalyptus and a briar patch. A lean palate offers aroma-matching flavors of green herbs along with plum, cherry and clay notes. This is oaky and resiny tasting on the finish, and hot as well.

title: Pazo de Barrantes 2012 La Comtesse Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Yeasty aromas are devoid of fruit, commitment and minerality, and instead smell oddly floral and unconvincing. A waxy, wan palate and oaky flavors of clove finish with resiny, pushy spice notes. This tastes overly oaky and resiny, like the winery's Rioja white called La Capellanía but without the goods.

title: Finca Salazar 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Oily aromas of orange peel are inoffensive. A shearing palate offers little textural pleasure or complexity. Flavors of lemon and blood orange finish with a sour note of underripe pineapple.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Cooperativa Reguengos de Monsaraz 2014 Monsaraz Branco White (Alentejo)
description: The wine is fruity, although with a yeasty character that leaves a bready taste. It has acidity, ripe yellow fruits and the fruitiness may come to dominate although that is not certain.

title: Buena Vista 2013 Private Reserve Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: This somewhat indistinctive wine has a wealth of minty aroma on the nose, a characteristic that doesn't shake off on the palate, the body full and a touch hot.

title: Armanino Family Cellars 2013 The Pintail Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)
description: There's something mushroomy and feral about this wine, which finishes with sour cherry.

title: Lechthaler 2014 Drago Pinot Grigio (Trentino)
description: The nose isn't very expressive but you can detect whiffs of adhesive bandage, medicinal herb, apple skin and mineral that carry over to the diluted, rather bitter palate. Brisk acidity underscores the wine's lean character.

title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Castelo do Sulco Colheita White (Lisboa)
description: A blend of Moscatel and Arinto, this is light and thin with only the vaguest hint of citrus fruit acidity. It should be drunk now.

title: Pagos del Rey 2014 Altos de Tamaron  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Candied raspberry aromas and a racy, acidic, crisp feel tell you what's coming: pie-cherry tartness and then a sizzle-and-pop finish that's fresh but astringent.

title: Pat Paulsen Vineyards 2013 England-Shaw Vienyard Syrah (Solano County)
description: Balsamic aromas and strong pruney flavors combine for a heavy-handed taste in this full-bodied wine. It seems to be well-aged already, so drink it soon if you like this style.

title: Mossback 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy and stemmy in dark black fruit, this wine contains 2% Syrah from Dunnigan Hills, though it's unclear how that contributes. Thin on the palate, it has a medicinal, minty flourish on the finish.

title: Lechthaler 2014 Torre di Luna Pinot Grigio (Trentino)
description: This uber-informal wine has faint aromas that recall pressed wildflower and a whiff of pear. The simple, diluted palate shows hints of apple skin and a bitter medicinal note alongside brisk acidity.

title: Finca Montepedroso 2014 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Oily aromas of citrus blend with leesy notes on a jumbled nose. This lacks freshness, while uncommitted flavors of lees and vitamins are slightly oxidized. Bitter citrus and pithy flavors control a finish that falls flat.

title: Zimri Cellars 2013 Beacon Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This is subdued, almost invisible, with herbal flavors accented with bitter greens. Barely ripe red fruit leaves a flat taste, with no life in it. Two bottles tasted.

title: Coast 2013 Chardonnay (California)
description: While very flavorful, this wine is more of a dessert drink than a lunch or dinner wine. It smells sweet and earthy, feels unctous and tastes sweet, especially on the finish.

title: Nathaniel Rose 2013 La Blonde Chris Glenn Vineyard Syrah (Lake Michigan Shore)
description: Raspberry preserves with whiffs of violet and white pepper mark the nose. A medium-bodied palate of red currant and blueberry meet twiggy flavors, carried by sharp acidity and grainy tannins.

title: South Coast NV Daybreak Signature Solera Library Selection Muscat Canelli (Temecula Valley)
description: Brown-pink in color, like a burnt rosé, this wine conveys strong caramel aromas reminiscent of brandy, cognac and bourbon. The palate is thick and treacly with strong flavors of wood and cherry-laced caramel, with a raisiny finish.

title: Restivo 2015 Silver Series Malbec (Mendoza)
description: This murky Malbec has odd, horsey, berry aromas. It's rough and raw on the palate, with leafy, herbal plum flavors that finish rugged and with a dull spiciness.

title: Subida di Monte 2014 Malvasia (Collio)
description: This wine reflects the difficulty of the cool, wet 2014 vintage. It's lean and diluted, with medicinal sensations that recall adhesive bandage and mineral.

title: Chime 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: The earthy aromas of this medium-bodied wine will not be to everyone's liking, but it follows up with very ripe fruit flavors and a smooth texture.

title: Marqués de Alella 2014 Pansa Blanca (Alella)
description: Oily citrus peel and lanolin aromas are a harsh welcome to this varietal Xarello, also known as Pansa Blanca in the Penedès. The palate runs flabby, while wan melon flavors are candied and lack punch.

title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 Terra de Touros Arinto (Tejo)
description: Fresh and crisp, this is a wine that has little flavor and only the thinest palate. It is bright to drink now.

title: Oeste Verde 2013 Diaz R Cabernet Franc (San Juan)
description: A strange one from start to finish, this opens with unusual floral aromas that include orange peel and vanilla cookie. The palate is flat-out messy, with jammy weight. Herbal, odd flavors of blueberry and cardamom finish heavy, with raisin and licorice notes.

title: Casa de Vila Verde 2014 Pluma Reserva Alvarinho (Minho)
description: This is an oak aged wine that is trying too hard. It's only toast and juicy acidity from wood. It could possibly fill out with fruit although that is unlikely.

title: Valderiz 2014 Valdehermoso Joven  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Gumball, berry and horsey, rubbery aromas announce a hard, briny style of Tempranillo. Earthy flavors include stalky berry fruits and burnt coffee, while the finish follows with hard, peppery toughness.

title: Haywood 2011 Los Chamizal Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine offers more power and heat on the palate than would be expected given the listed alcohol by volume, a hammering of huge tannins holding the fruit hostage. An unpleasant fish-sauce aroma mars the nose.

title: Finca Antigua 2014 El Palomar Viura (La Mancha)
description: Lees, yeast and pickled cabbage aromas are hardly inviting. This seems out of shape and globular. Yeasty, briny, bitter flavors of citrus and melon end green, with an onion note.

title: Maximo 2013 Edicion Limitada Viura (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Mealy aromas of compostable white fruits lack freshness. This is high in acid but low on body. Briny flavors scream sauerkraut, while the finish tastes pickled and feels caustic.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Donkey & Goat 2012 Broken Leg Vineyard, The Recluse Syrah (Anderson Valley)
description: The sweet aromas of this wine are like boysenberry syrup, but flavors are very lean, dry, smoky and tart. The texture coats the palate with puckering tannins.
